segments.text: I'm looking at this woman, and I just can't believe what I'm seeing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing right there, completely oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone not notice their sink overflowing right at their feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus on that single plate is truly remarkable, almost to the point of absurdity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange kind of tunnel vision, ignoring the larger, more pressing issue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A significant amount of water is now flooding the kitchen floor, making it dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she feel the cold water soaking her shoe?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost sad, this profound lack of perception, like she's lost in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s missing so much that's happening right behind her as well.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to no good, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder what else she might be missing in her life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene really highlights a disquieting level of inattention.
segments.speaker: PAR
